summary: This document is an email communication from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing a potential meeting location. The email emphasizes confidentiality and attorney-client privilege, indicating the sensitive nature of the communication.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the sender of the email, suggesting a meeting with Jes Staley.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the recipient of the email, being invited to meet by Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein is reaching out to Staley to arrange a meeting, indicating a personal or professional relationship.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein suggests meeting at 'bills burgers' or at Staley's office.
The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating it may be attorney-client privileged.
The communication emphasizes that unauthorized use or disclosure is prohibited.
There is a mention of JPMorgan Chase, suggesting a financial context.
